heading: Objective
body: Build authentic emotional connection through empathy, curiosity, and personalization—so the guest feels understood, safe, and excited to move forward with confidence.

heading: Mindset
body: Emotional connection is not a trick—it is respect in action. Our role is to create comfort, clarity, and confidence while serving the guest’s goals.
notes: Use as a short mindset block near the top.

heading: Core Idea
body: Guests rarely decide by specs alone; they decide when the vehicle fits their life and they feel safe with the person guiding them.
notes: Use as the anchor sentence for the module.

heading: 2.0 The Science
body: Vehicle purchases trigger uncertainty, vulnerability, identity, and social pressure. Emotional connection lowers threat and increases confidence.

heading: Psychological Safety
body: When guests feel safe, they share more truth. When they feel judged or pressured, they protect themselves with vagueness or shutdown.

heading: Empathy Builds Trust
body: Trust accelerates when we reflect, validate, and confirm before solving.
notes: Put RVC framework in scripts section too.

heading: Identity-Based Decisions
body: People buy a version of themselves: responsible parent, smart planner, adventurer, comfort seeker, capable provider.
notes: Use this to guide benefit wording.

heading: Future Pacing
body: When guests imagine ownership in vivid, real-life scenes, confidence increases.

heading: Peak-End Moments
body: Guests remember emotional peaks and endings—plan one “aha” moment and end each phase with calm clarity.

heading: Choice Comfort
body: Too many options increases anxiety. Clarity lowers cognitive load.

heading: 70/30 Rule
body: Aim for the guest to talk more than you. Emotional connection requires listening and micro-confirmations.

heading: Permission-Based Language
body: Earn the right to go deeper with respectful permission asks.
bullets: Can I ask…|Would it help if…|Do you mind if…

heading: Micro-Confirmations
body: Every 60–90 seconds, check alignment and comfort.
bullets: How does that feel?|Is that matching what you pictured?|Does that solve it?
notes: Use across walkaround and test drive.

heading: No Manipulation
body: Avoid guilt, fear tactics, and pressure timelines. We build urgency through clarity, not intensity.

heading: RVC Word Track
body: Reflect + Validate + Confirm before problem solving.
notes: Put as a copy-paste block in scripts.

heading: Why Ladder
body: Find the emotional driver behind a need by asking one or two ‘why’ layers (with permission).

heading: Values Bridge Sentence
body: Connect need → feature → feeling → real-life moment.
bullets: Because you mentioned…|This helps give you…|Especially when…

heading: Future Pacing Prompts
body: Use specific life scenes to make benefits feel real.

heading: Role-Play Focus
body: Practice emotional connection under real-world pressure: empathy, why ladder, future pacing, objections, peak-end moments.

heading: Worksheet Purpose
body: Reinforce values mapping, RVC practice, future pacing questions, and a personal ‘shared mission’ line for daily use.
